topic.title: ZeroNet DevTalk
topic.body:
Check out http://127.0.0.1:43110/17xKC3hfQkuGqqRGCwGqUATXXmodAfdPPG/ for ZeroNet developmental talk.

Post any questions that you may have or interesting ideas. Hope to see you there and thank you in advance.

1587058576_19XvDasRMiaZ1KijQUHjJ7nEEJMWu.body: How do I make it work for everyone, it works on my end... I just copied and pasted the ZeroTalk template.

@filips

Thanks for the input. Do you know how to sticky a topic at the top in these forums? I don't mean ZeroTalk because I know that I'd need to be an admin of ZeroTalk to do so but in my own ZeroTalk clone? Thanks.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1365_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Just noting that there are already quite a few dev talks, e.g.: [...]

None of these are truly active or very informational in regards to the basics or even more complicated aspects of ZeroNet.

> [filips](#comment_442_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): You need to edit content.json of site and configure settings. For example, this is how it is done for ZeroTalk: [...]

How do you [code][/code] stuff like you did with the settings string from the content.json file? Thank you in advance.

PS. Is there also one for bold? Like [b][/b] ??

> [filips](#comment_443_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): ZeroTalk is using Markdown. You can read this for details about syntax. [...]

Thanks that was very helpful. Just to check is the link in the opening post working?
